result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis A Eckstein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the defendant is to receive sentence credit from 01/26/2016 to the sentencing date of 03/15/2016.

miscConds.notes: Court orders the $250 cash bond on file in 2016CM24 be applied to the court costs on this case.

-Defendant is to complete an alcohol and drug abuse assessment (AODA) and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis A Eckstein

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Per Agent Deb Duel - the defendant has paid all the financial obligations and has complied with all conditions of probation.
43
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 6 months (09/15/2017)

1:06 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Deb Duel present in court.  FTP $193.  Statement by defendant.  Statement by Agent Duel - extend for 6 months.  Court finds the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for 6 months.  Court informs defendant that if not paid, court will fashion conditions to include jail time.

Court adjourned at 1:08 p.m.
Probation review hearing on February 13, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: from Atty Jon Wilsnack - has no objection to amending the sentence to being applied to 2016CM26 instead of 2016CM24. (VIA FAX)
from Circuit Court to counsel dated April 13, 2016 in regards to the sentence on 2016CM24 & 2016CM26.  Counsel have 10 days to respond.

11:22 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 on 2015CM279 and count 1 on 2016CM26 and 2016CM24 will be dismissed and read-in and defense is free to argue.  State concurs.  Atty Wilsnack concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as a repeater.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 on 2015CM279 as charged & count 1 on 2016CM24 as charged.  Court ordes 2016CM26 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Wilsnack.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

*2015CM279 - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs
-Defendant is to complete an alcohol and drug abuse assessment (AODA) and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Absolute sobriety.
-DNA sample

Court grants the defendant sentence credit of 2 days on 2015CM279.

*2016CM24 - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to complete an alcohol and drug abuse assessment (AODA) and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Absolute sobriety.
-DNA sample

2016CM24 - Court grants the defendant sentence credit of:  sentence credit from 01/26/ 2016 to today.


Court adjourned at 11:35 a.m.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.

12:53 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  ADA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $1,00000 cash bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court will set for Status Hearing on February 9, 2016 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 12:56 a.m.
